title: A pleasant new ballad of the Miller of Mansfield, in Sherwood and of King Henry the second, and how he was lodged in the millers house, and of their pleasant communication To the tune of, The French Lavolta.
publisher: for E. Wright, dwelling at Christ-Church Gate,
notes: An edition of: A pleasant ballad of King Henry II. and the miller of Mansfield.
Verse - "Henry our royall King would ride a hunting,".
Identified as Wing P2554A(a) on UMI microfilm set "Early English books, 1641-1700", reel 2123.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
